text: Bottle from Top Shelf Liquor. Aroma is banana, booze, yeast, tropical fruit, earthy hops. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, light tan head. Taste is banana, yeast, wheat, old, booze, metallic, bad. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, yeast, wheat old aftertaste. Overall, Ive definitely had better.

From a bottle from a Polish deli. Pours clear light bronze. Aroma is sweet wheat. Flavor is sweet with some off phenolic flavors. Most kristalls leave a little more wheat flavor behind than this one does. I think by hunting for a little bit higher abv they tarnished the flavor profile.

Bottle. Pours an amber color with generous foamy off-white head and lively carbonation. Mostly yeasty aroma with banana notes. Somewhat sweet flavor with a bit of spices and banana. Light bodied with a creamy mouthfeel. Decent.

Aroma: banana esters, medium wheat aroma, bubblegum.
Appearance: gold color without head.
Taste: malt, wheat, banana.
Palate: medium body, high carbonation, creamy.
Bottle. Clear gold with a white head and steady carbonation bubbles. The aroma is wheat malt with banana and the taste follows. There was a slight bitterness on the back end.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow gold body with a nice frothy white head that left some light lacing. The nose is very light wheat with a light fruity ester quality. The flavor is pretty solid, lots of Hefe character, especially banana bread. The yeast is not there, but theres clearly a lot of yeast influence. Nice clean light wheat. Light bodied and fizzy with soft carbonation and a lingering fruity finish. This is surprisingly good, and has a lot more character than I was expecting. Good beer.

500 ml bottle. Transparent golden colour brew. Hissing 1 finger porous white head. Stays for about 2 minutes. Massive spritzy carbonation. The aroma reflects all hefeweizen features like bubblegum, banana, sour apples, wheat & flour. Flavour is clean almost like dry cider green apple, fizzy, lemon, malts. Medium body. Not bad.
At Espress, Bamberg. Clear golden beer, medium head. Aroma is wheat, banana. Taste is the same, not bad.
Bottle pour. One finger head with decent lacing. Aroma is banana and wheat. Taste follows aroma. I really enjoyed this beer. To me, this is a great example of the style.
Gennemsnitlig god øl. Farven er lys gul med en stor hvid skumkrone. Smagen og aromaen er banan, citrus og kløver.

500ml bottle from a trade with vinivini (massive thanks for getting this kristall to me that is currently in the top 50!!). ABV is 5.1%. Pours clear gold with big fluffy white head that lasts. Aroma is wheat, bubblegum, pear. Taste is banana, wheat, yeast. A solid kristallweizen.
Bottle purchased in Kansas City. Pours clear golden, large foamy white head. Aroma was bread, yeast, wheat. Taste was sweet, banana, wheat, peppery.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 17/VI/16 - 50cl bottle from some drinks shop around Aalst @ home - BB: 21/VI/16 (2016-658) 
Clear dark blond beer, creamy big irregular head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: somewhat sweet, lots of banana, bit yeasty, some almonds. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots and lots of banana, bit sweet, yeasty touch, little sourish. Aftertaste: little bitter, malty, lots of banana, bit malty, grains. Decent stuff.

Bottle with 5.1 ABV. Clear golden. Huge dense white rocky head. Stays for some minutes. Nose of spicy yeast, wheat malt. Light body. Thin to oily. Sweetish taste. Wheat malt, minimal banana. Yeasty. Spicy. Low bitterness as its the usual case with the style. Pleasant.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle, shared with Rockley. Light golden body, thick meringue of a head that shows remarkable retention. Lightly spicy, ripe banana, soft wheat. Good.

text: 16.9 oz bottle pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, fruit and yeast. Taste is grain, yeast and some banana.

Spisane z Notatek kiedy Ratebeer był w zeszycie i główne poszukiwania nowych piw i smaków, odkrywanie świata to były głównie piwa zagraniczne w dużej mierze niemieckie,

Bottle. Pours golden orange with a white head. Off fruity sweetness, light wheaty base, and old bubblegum. Seems old or off.

Bottle, picked up at Bevmo. Pours crystal clear pale golden, medium white head, dissipates quickly with decent lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon, grain. Flavor is very light sweet, wheat, bubblegum. Lightish body.
Boa weizen. Belíssimo aroma, corpo, cor e sabor. Desceu super bem. Vale tomar de novo.

bottle @ Jungle Jims / Eastgate OH --- Clear medium amber with a persistent 1" white head, lace that slides back into the drink. Aroma is good European Pilsener - malt and floral hops. Taste is malt and hops, for sure, but mostly it is carbonation. The fizz is sharp, and somewhat refreshing, but it covers everything else. This one needs better balance.

Bottle I took to James house for the End of History tasting. Pours a mostly clear gold with a thin white head. Sweet grain on the nose. Medium bodied, quite sweet, candied bananas. Grainy and sweet. Unpleasant and not tasty.

Bottle shared at the End of History tasting. Aroma of stale angel food, pears, and bread crust. Pours clear with nice carbonation and a quick head. Taste is cardboard, pear stems, and stale bread crust. This style is obviously supposed to be light but the lingering taste is off-putting. Not good.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, straw, yeasty with hints of fruit. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a dry finish.
Standard, clean, nice German. Golden colored. Wheaty, somewhat bubblegum aroma. Tastes lots of banana, yeast, clove. Light bodied. Just fine.

The Kristall version of Tucher Helles Hefe Weizen, so filtered and clear, with pretty golden blonde colour. Malty character with weakish apple-like esters and subtle presence of wheat. Honest and thirst-quenching, typical Kristallweizen but the filtering has deprived it a bit of its original complexity and elegance.

I requested this bottle for Jay to bring to End of History tasting since i need the Kristallweizen tick, i apologize to my fellow beer drinkers. pours yellow, skunky wheat aroma. tastes of cardboard, wheat, banana, grains. no good but so good to get
Bottle. Yellow pour with no head . Off malty aromas. Wet wheat, malt and off flavors. Gross.
Basically a watered down version of the "regular" hefeweizen Tucher makes. Good, but not great like that hefeweizen! Just a lighter yeasty wheaty flavor with no real banana or clove notes. Good.
Rated based on notes taken on 23 Dec 2011 -- A very refreshing light summer time beer.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours pale yellow with thick white head. Taste wheat, bubblegum, banana. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:

Banana, wheat aroma.
Taste is fairly dry...wheat malt, banana, grain..

June 10, 2014 - on tap at Zum Spiessgesellen. Cloudy yellow pour with some head that lasted. Citrus and wheat strong in aroma and taste. A little bit of spice was noticeable in aroma and taste.

From bottle. Pour is semi-clean amber. Two fingers of white head. No lacing. Aroma is unmistakably German: simple, sweet cereal and bananas. Taste is darker than a normal heffeweizen. Wheat forward, with banana and minimal cloves on finish. Similar to other bees from this brewery, a distinct breakfast cereal vibe. Sparkling. Enjoyed. This is as solid as every day German beers come.

golden, clear, sparkling, big, strong and dense white foam; cloves, aroma and bread in aroma; light bitterness, light plus sweetness, very slightly sour; light body, creamy but little "stingy" feel, lively carbonation, long sweetish tart aroma;
Overall: refreshing, quite drinkable, good
Hazy dark yellow in color. Sweet malty aroma. Bready, banana notes. Good example of class
bottle from the brown derby A: banana, cloves , bready . App: clear pale no head t/p: thin body with acidic but short finish. o: pretty decent.
Pours a clear golden color with a bumpy white head. Bubble gummy and very lightly spicy. Oily mouthfeel. Bubble gum, very mild spiciness, and finishes with a sweet Chardonnay.

Aroma of cereal, bread, clove, banana, slight citrus. Very nice appearance, deep golden color and white billowing head, lacing. Flavor is tart but equally balanced by the creamy sweetness and slight bitterness. Light body, creamy and slick texture, lively carbonation, long and smooth finish.

Hellgelb, blank mit schöner Schaumkrone mittlerer Standzeit. Hefige Banane mit Citrusanklängen. Prickelnd und erfrischend. Säuerlich und etwas schwachbrüstig im Abgang. Einfach zu trinken; Marke Durstlöscher.

Pours a light golden color with a small head that fades quickly with only bits of lacing. Aroma is primarily fruity with a mix of apple bit of banana and citrus. Taste of fruit bit of citrus and malt sweetness. Has a mild bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, crisp, clean and refreshing. Enjoyable beer that goes down easy. Serving type: bottle

September 2011. From bottle. Poured clear pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of malt, hay, clove and tropical fruit. Tart and citrusy.

Pours a clear golden color with nice head. Aromas of banana fruit, slight spice, bread, yeast, and grain. Palate is light, with flavors of yeast esters, banana, slight spice, and wheat. Fairly full bodied for a Kristall, nice.

Great! Light and easy. Filtered a little too much to call a weizen but it's still good.

The color of this beer is golden with a quickly fading white head, and the aroma is subtle with hints of wheat and dough yeast. The taste is quite sweet and slightly sour, and the palate is overall crisp, which combines a thin texture, lively carbonation, light body, and an abrupt finish.

Ładne się piana pieni nad tym złocistym piwem, wysycenie spore i trochę gryzące co utrudnia degustowanie większymi łykami. Kolor jak w pilsnerze niemieckim ale w smaku oczywiście wyraźnie pszeniczne. Sporo się miało wrażeń w tym krystalicznie czystym pszeniczniaku.

Pale amber color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat/grass, yeast, & some bananas; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, and some citrus; Overall, this was just decent for me.
Nice, maybe more flavoured naturally than most Kristall. NIce aroma and foam and fine character too.

The flavor on this is not nearly as assertive as the aroma.  Starts with a gentle, soft, minerally carbonation, with like prickly sensation.  Has a little bubblegum and banana estery flavors in the middle.  Finishes with more metallic flavors and heavy on the minerals.  This is a delicate, highly drinkable, and enjoyable beer.  Well-crafted.

1 pint, 9 oz. Pours a  translucent yellow. White foamy head.  Aroma of sugar, banana, and bubblegum.  Taste loads of wheat and pilsner malts.  Hints of bubblegum and banana. Active carbonation.  Very light mouth feel.  Kinda watered down.  Fizzy wheat finish.  Pretty boring no complexity.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 This light golden beer has a durable white head that leaves exceptional lacing.  The body is thin with medium-high, soft carbonation. 
The aroma features yeasty banana and cloves. As expected then, the flavor is fruity with banana, vague light fruit juice, and yeast. Perhaps true enough to style but a bit under-hopped for my tastes.
Bottle. Light banana, citrus, and wheat aroma. Clear gold with a ginormous off-white head, good retention. Sweet banana and wheat malt flavor with a light spicy finish. Medium  body, low carbonation.

Pours with a large white head on top of a golden body. Aroma is full of the banana like hefe yeast smell, but has a wheat edge that hit the nose as slightly stale. Taste is similar - wild with a stale-like wheat edge. Palate is very dry, but a bit unpleasantly.

Bottle thanks to MarkWise. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose/taste of banana, bubblegum, herbal mint, light wheat malt and clove. Finishes clove/slight herbal spice wheat malt. Lighter to medium body.

text: Pours a pale watery yellow with a big frothy white head.  Aroma of citrus and banana.  Taste is very similar to aroma, except the banana is clearly dominant.  Crisp, light, and refreshing.  Very easy to drink.

16.9oz bottle 3/31/12 (Binnys Downers Grove)-38° in Weizen Glass-Pours a clear medium golden with a big three finger head. Aroma of banana, clovem and wheat. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is very tasty, Good brew.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours clear golden with small white head.  Very good lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and light banana aroma.  Taste is banana.  Refreshing, but pretty boring for a wheat beer.
A clear golden beer with barely any head at all.  The aroma is slightly sweet yeast and citrus.  The flavor is kind of fruity and bright, but not that great.

Bottle. Poured a light yellow color with a two finger white head. Head was gone rather quick. Blah. Beer was pretty average. Aroma was faint grass, lemon and bubblegum. Flavor was weak. Banana, milldew and straw. High carbonation. Thin and watery body. Like I said kind of bland and not very memorable.
Very tangy, with a flavors of lemon and slight fruit. kind of sweet but not hoppy at all. a nice cool, refreshing beer for the spring.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/30/2009.  Poured from a 16.9 oz bottle into a Weizen glass.

The Kristall Weizen pours a delicate golden color, more robust in the thicker parts of the glass. A thick fluffy white head forms immediately, fading to leave a 2 cm head remaining. Noticeable perpetual carbonation rises from the bottom of the glass to keep the head fresh.

Light lemon notes, but the main aroma is floral. Not a strong smell overall, but it seems to drift casually up from the beer. 

A mostly floral wheat taste from start to finish. Hints of lemon zest and bananas poke their way through as well. There is not much of a hop presence, not that I would expect much in a weizen like this. 

Definitely a smooth feel; the carbonation and wheat flavor give it a light, pleasant feel on the tongue. 

The light floral flavors do not really move me, but that is probably a comment on the style more than this one in particular.  Not one that I am really going to go out of my way to buy.

Yellow and clear with tons of white head and lacing.  Yeasty smelling to the max.  Taste is quite yeasty with lots of banana and clove.  I think its a fine beer, quite easy to drink and Id certainly like another.

Pours transparent and golden.  Small white rocky head.  Nose is sweet banana and sour apples.  I smell some funk in this that would hint it going toward a berliner-weiss.  The taste however is a let down from the previous hope and all I get is a sugar over sweet taste with nothing else.  The mouthfeel is good, crisp and leaves the mouth well coated, again, the flavor left on the pallet isnt the best.

Aroma of honey, banana, red grape, light clove and light herbal hops. Appearance was gold with light bubbly head. Flavor started with sharp, unpleasant fruit notes, moved to some light gum and clove, and finished with just a hint of dry herbal hops. Palate was the strong point here; chewy and bubbly with pleasant softness. Just wasnt impressed by this one; the Weihestephaner was much better.

Purchased at San Pedro Wal Mart for 30 pesos a 500 ml bottle Well,this beer was one of the most tasteless beers (that is not American or a Pale Lager),taste like a lught macro,didnt have much of aroma and the palate felt,well it didnt have much character.Very grey kind of beer.

bottle. clear, golden amber with small white head. aroma of spices, citrus and lemon rind, light pepper, and hints of clove...flavor of light banana, sweet breads, and a touch of cinnamon. some hints of other spice and perhaps some faint walnut...interesting and quite nice

500 ml bottle picked up in Germany. Pours a pale yellow, with a massive fluffy white head. Aroma is banans, wheat and cloves. Good wheat taste, some banana and spice too. Palate is light bodied, fresh, a decent beer.

Tasted from bottle into standard pint glass. Pours a crystal-clear (hence the name) golden-orange color with off-white head which fades fairly quickly, no lace. Some distinctive wheat ale aromas/flavors--doughy, bready, with banana, clove, and citrus yeast phenols--but not much, the overall effect is quite neutral. Banana and bubble gum aromas increase as it warms. Kristallweizen is the filtered style of German wheat ale (as opposed to hefeweizen, which retains the yeast in suspension.) In general, the public prefers the brilliance and clarity of light golden beers, but I personally prefer the cloudy appearance and improved taste, body, mouthfeel and bottle finishing characteristics of yeast. I could see the appeal of this beer to some people, but it just seems like a boring version of a better beer to me.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter. Appearance is a translucent gold with a nice head of white foam. Aroma is a delicate blend of esters and wheat. Taste is bananas and clove just barely making a showing, but its nice enough to be pleasant. Finish is short.

This one pours a very carbonated yellow body with a nice plush white head. The scent is light of hops with a subtle bitter citrus nose. Flavors are great, lots of carbonation give more bitterness to the refreshing orange undertone. Finishes a little bitter, but not too dry either.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Wheat grain and not much else in the aroma.  The flavor is banana split, light yeast and wheat grain.  Though easy to drink, everything about this is too subdued and boring.
Pours a clear yellow color, had a thick white head, aromas of clove, banana,  and malt.  Flavors of banana, clove, and a hint of vanilla, honey, and yeast.  Light on the palate, very sessionable.
Bottle from Chans, cloudy yellow gold with thin white foam, aroma has a lot of clove with flavor of banana, strong clove overtone, fruity banana finish

Color is translucent pale gold. Livelier effervescence than the Weihenstahpener Kristall.

The body is light but does retain some creaminess from the wheat. Carbonation is fairly high.

The aroma is banana cream pie with the vanilla pudding, and bananas, and crust, and all.

The taste is pale malt and sweet wheat, vanilla or oak, apple and banana esters, and a touch of yeast.

16.9 ounce bottle - $2.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours clear, golden in appearance, with a tall, foamy, whitish head.

Smell: Sweetish nose, smelling of malted wheat, natch, with a faroff hint of lemon drop candy.

Taste: Middling maltiness, lightly wheaty, with very, very, very small touches of light-colored caramel and honey. Moderately sweet. Near nil lemon included, but, sorry, not really picking up any spice, banana, hop character, and bitterness. Just a fairly clean beer throughout. Sweetish taste of honey wheat loaf on the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium (just barely) carbonation.

Overall: About average for a kristalweizen, and, when tried side-by-side with Tuchers underpowered hefe, I preferred actually this.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 The missus liked it but I wasnt so into it.  Some banana aroma but a little lager like. Decent for the style though. Some misplaced sweetness. Serving: Bottle

Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass very zippy, huge head. Sweet aroma. Also starts quite sweet, fine fruity like apricot and banana. Finish still very sweet, only modest hoppy, some notes of hay and sugar. Not bad!

Crystal clear gold with a big, fluffy white head. Drippy white lace. Nice floral hop nose, a touch of spice and banana. Pleasant, crisp wheat flavor, lightly grainy, clove and banana. I added a little lemon to it.  Good stuff.

light gold pour with a big off white almost beige head, great retention and lace... the nose is terrible, skunky grains, reminds me a really bad pilsner... the taste is very sweet, almost sweet to the point I think there is sugar in this, no hops at all, just sweet grains with a little alcohol on the finish... all over the place, a complete mess

UPDATED: APR 27, 2011 Bottle @ home. Pours a transparent pale yellow appearance with a big off white head. Light wheat malty nose with fruity banana esters and a hint of clove. Clean easy drinking German weizen with a fairly strong banana flavor. Very smooth and sweet Kristallweizen.

A clear, yellow-orange pour with a frothy white head.  The aroma has banana, cloves, and some bread.  The light body has a slightly thin texture with average carbonation.  The taste is on the sweet side with only a hint of hop bitterness right before the finish.  This is a good thirst quencher on warm days.

A: The pour is a clear pale golden straw color with a moderate amount of white foam.

S: Intensely sweet nose.  It mostly smells like banana candy (banana flavored runts seem to be a good comparison).  Minimal wheat and bread and almost no spice notes at all.

T: Surprisingly, the flavor is much, much better.  Nice banana and clove esters with a moderate sweetness of wheat and bread.  There is a little bit of clove in there, but still restrained compared to other beers of the style.

M: Medium in body with a moderate carbonation.

O: Nice wheat beer here.  The nose was a little off-putting, but a nice flavor.
500ml bottle.Pours a clear yellow with a large white fluffy head.Nose is lemon and light banana.Taste is crisp and creamy with banana and citrus notes.Mouthfeel is right but the rest is ehh.Decent..

16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a clear, pale straw with a thick frothy head. The aroma is lemon peels, hay and faint honeysuckle. The flavor is subtly sweet with a touch of bitterness in the finish. The palate is light to medium, acidic and very carbonated. Overall, a clean and crisp beer, but nothing special.

I found this very clean and enjoyable. Seems like this would be awesome with brunch.
It is a light and airy, and ultimately nicely drinkable Kristall Weizen. In the flavor are hints of wheat and bananas.
1/2 liter bottle- Poured yellow/golden with a nice head and left some lacing. Smooth, a good beer on a hot day, but lacked flavor.

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a tall dense white head. aroma of wheat and clove, only slightly fruity, with hints of yoghurt and some strangely appealing medicinal notes. flavour is quite inoffensive, mostly wheat, with hints of clove and banana. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Mouthfeel is muted and only slightly tingly. Taste is har dto pick up, as nothing from the nose really stands out. Finsih, while pleasant, is fairly non-descript, although the beer is a nice thirst quencher.

Light wheat and banana notes in the aroma. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head that left a little bit of lacing. Flavors of banana, cloves and wheat. Lively carbonation that finished a little bit sweet. Though the Kristallweizen isnt a very good style, this beer manages to be respectable.

Aroma is fairly strong, yeasty and wheaty with just a touch of citrus. It pours a rather wan clear yellow, but at least it has a fairly thick and persistent white head. Flavor is typical for a wheat beer, yeasty and a little thick with more than a hint of lemon, pleasant if not outstanding. Texture is smooth and refreshing and a little tingly.

An okay Kristallweizen but not really up to the high standard of some German wheat beers.  Bright middle yellow, clear, big but quickly dissipating head.  Somewhat thin aroma, banana/spice.  Not enough wheat depth and complexity.  Similar flavor.  A wheat beer that is lacking in character somewhat.

Many of you probably never had a chance to try this beer.   While Ill admit that Ive not even tried 10 beers on the top Kristallweizen beers list on this site, I can tell you that Tucher makes a better product than Erdinger, Weihenstephaner, Franziskhaner, Hacker-Pschorr, and (probably) both Hofbraeu and Edelweiss.  Above all, dont believe the reviews on Kristallweizen here until youve tried a fresh Tucher Kristallweizen.  If you want to experience THE beer you should put to your lips after a hot afternoon (NOT the office) of labor, this is the beer offering the most refreshing taste on any continent.
Clear golden with a large white head. Sweet aroma with fruity and wheat notes. Flavour was sweet wheaty with fruits towards the soft finish.

Bottled. A pale golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and dust. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and straw as wel as light notes of cardboard. A bit boring.
50 cL bottle. Pours clear and pale yellow with a huge and white head. Aroma is dry wheaty and vague estery. Dry wheaty and vague fruity flavoured. dry finish, dry wheaty and vague estery.

500ml bottle. Pours a golden with a thin white head which leaves quickly. Has okay lacing. Aroma is fruity with hints of banana, lemons and wheat. Has a decent carbonation. The flavoris pretty good. All the aromas come out in the flavor. Has a medium to light body. A thicker than tinner texture.
Had a bottle of this into a glass at a fancy restaurant.  Not bad for a good old filtered German wheat.  Almost like a hefe-light... its smooth and very drinkable.

Another Kristalweisse. Bottle. Clear yellow pour with a largish, white head. Aroma of grain, sulfur, wheat, skunk, banana, and some sort of hard candy I cant place my finger on. Touch of spicy clove on the back end. Taste is weak, light, grainy, rubbery, light banana and clove grains. Pretty light and boring. Thin and fizzy. Run of the mill, soulless, kristal.

500 ml bottle purchased at Gomers in Lees Summit, Missouri.  Pour is clear lighter golden with a few carbonation bubbles and a big fluffy four inch white head.  Head falls very slowly with nice thick lacing.  Aroma of citrus lemon, some lemon peel, light sweet bubblegum, and a nice natural grain wheat component.  Rounded and nice inviting nose.  Taste is floral lemons followed closely by the grainy wheat.  Finish is pretty dirty, with the lemon being less pleasant then the start, almost a lemon pledge sort of bite to it.  Despite this, the finish is very brief, so does not end up detracting too much.  Palate is thin to watery, above average carbonation.  Overall, a nice enough, clean enough, drinkable enough beer that lacks the character of a straight Hefeweizen, even the Tucher Hefe.

Oh my God this blows!  The aroma is serious skunk.  Only the slightest trace of wheat.  The appearance is like a filtered hefe, which makes the beer look like a pilsener.  Straw gold, white head.  The flavor also has some skunk, some wheat, light spices, truly a watered down hefe.  The finish has the tiniest bittering, barely recognizable.  Thin/medium mouthfeel.
Clear gold pour, with frothy white head.  Grain, light fruit, apple, grass, and some floral hops,.  Slightly sour.  I thought it was a pretty good kristallweizen.
Poured clear golden yellow, malty, grainy, fruity, little grassy, slight spice.

Bottle pours a crystal clear, pale golden yellow with a huge white foam.  Fairly light aroma with clove and banana being the most noticeable scents.  Much more banana in the flavor mixed with wheat and vanilla in the aftertaste.  Just a touch of bitterness in the finish.  Not bad as it has a decent flavor and is easy to drink.
Pours a clear golden with a huge white head. Aroma is clove, fruity, with faint hints of grass. Flavor is light clove, wheaty tartness, and wet grain.
Pours a light golden body with a white head.  Sweet with hints of fruity esters bananas, apples and a light spicy cinnamon character.  Lots of wheat and lemon grass thin with hints of bubblegum.

nose of cereal malts and light hops. appearnce is of perfect ginger ale.  flavor is of sloppy malts and devoid of the hops from the nose.  yeast esthers are not present, no surprise there.  similar in some ways to a bad berliner weiss, but without the stinging bitterness.  this comes across as yet another dull pilsner, wheats copious advantages are lost here.

Pours clear pale golden color with white head. Aromas of wheat, clover and banana with some fruitiness. Light fruity flavor with cereal grain and banana. Light body with lively carbonation and a crisp finish.
Golden pour with nice head. Nose of grains, bread and wheat. Flavor is more pilsner than I expected, but refreshing...some banana flavors as well.

Bottle: Golden, lively carbonatin, stable creamy white head; wheaty-fruity nose with an odd touch of vegetables; light sourish flavour, light bodied as well, a bit sticky nevertheless; light bitterness detectable in the sourish-wheaty, slightly musty finish. No, no..........

Pours a very clear golden straw color. At first there is an enormous head, but the retention is not that great. The beer smells both stinky and fruity at once with bit of banana and skunk, not the best combination.... at least its faint. The flavor is nice, a little metallic but much better than expected.... Its like some sort of pils-hefe sort of clone inthe flavor. Very clean somewhat doughy low to moderate bitterness with all the bubblegum, banana, and spicy flavors turned all the way down. Ive certainly had better examples.

Pours a very clear lighter golden with tiny little bubbles and a big thin foamy sudsy white head.  Pleasant aroma sweet candied wheat and banana, some lager yeast and light noble hops.  Light flavors, doughy banana, lightly metallic.  Dry finish, faint bubble-gum, chalky banana.  Medium/light body, watery mouthful with light carbonation.  A nice drinkable kristallweizen.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a big and dense foamy white head. Dusty and slightly sourish wheat-malty nose with traces of citrus, nutmeg and cloves. Light-sour-flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Wheaty malty, slightly fruity taste; slightly sourish wheaty and phenolic finish with a light touch of metal (02.XI.08).
At trinkgut boland in Kleve Kellen, golden, fluffy medium head, full grainy, lots of fruit, banana,  clove, raisin, vanilla, woody, nice complex one fore the style ,.,.3 days before end of date.
clear yellow, huge, quickly disipating white head, good lacing.  aroma of grainy malt.  flavor is corn and wheat with hints of malt.  oily mouth feel, grassy finish.  a refreshing brew.

This is my first Kristallweizen.  The body is crystal clear and golden-straw in color.  A massive, rocky, snow white head settles slowly to a 2mm layer of foam, with random spots and splotches of lacing marking the glass.  The aroma shows dry cereal grains, hints of banana esters, bubblegum, sweet, bready malts, and just a touch of earthy clove.  Flavors are crisp and grainy, floral, and lightly spicy.  The palate is effervescent and lively, most of its medium body seemingly derived from corn sugars.  Overall, I was not impressed with my first kristallweizen experience.  It resembled a completely filtered hefeweizen cut 50/50 with a pale lager, honestly.

Poured from bottle a clear light yellow with a large white head.  Aroma is soft with malt, clove and a bread.  Flavor is lightly sweet with honey, yeast, dough, clove and mild banana.  Palate starts with a good carbonation tingle and some malt but then seems a bit thin almost watery.  Overall, exceptionally easy to drink, but flavor is lacking as well as body.  I’d drink more but wouldn’t go out of my way to buy.

500ml bottle. Crystal clear gold with a big, fluffy white head. Drippy white lace. Nice floral hop nose, a touch of spice and banana. Pleasant, crisp wheat flavor, lightly grainy, clove and banana. Decent stuff for the style.
Bottled.  Clear pale golden creamy head. Restrained cardboard aroma. Sweet and fruity, medium bodied with spritzy but bold mouthfeel. Slightly phenolic. Lacking in character.

Bottle: Crisp clear golden with a creamy & thick white head. Wheaty nose with a touch of sweet dough and banana. Creamy and frothy feel. Light body with decent wheat malt presence, mild banana bread and some dough. Has a touch of grass towards the finish. Fairly simple, with low bitterness. Boring, but not horrible.

Kristal clear pale yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is mildly skunky with yeast, banana and mild fruit.  Taste of yeast, banana and light citrus.  Dry and crisp  not something I expect, or want, in a weiss beer.

Bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville. Pours a pale straw color with a medium glimmery foamy head. Banana and gummy bear aroma is very faint. Taste is banana, tropical fruit and grain. Medium body.

Hefeweizen tasting at Three Cellars Milwaukee.
VERY light. 
Pours gold with a thin head. Aromas of bananas,, lightly fruity. and lightly carbonated
From a bottle poured a clear light amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice flavor with a quick finish.

In the 0.5L bottle from HyVee CB. Pours an all-night pee gold with a large white head consisting of very big carbonation bubbles. Mild grainy aroma, but little else. The flavor is muted compared to a heavyweight such as Weihenstephaner Kristall. This manages to muster up a little bit of lemons at mid palate, but the body is appreciably watery overall. Bit of a harsh fizzy ending as well. This is somewhat overrated curretly at a 3. I can do without Tucher.

Pours golden with a thin head. Aromas of banannas,pears and orange. Pretty fruity. A mouthfeel slightly citrusy, and lightly carbonated. When it finishes, it seems to rehydrate your mouth, sounds wierd.

50cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa). Pours a clear, golden yellow with a thin white head that slightly laces the glass. Aroma: spice, complex fresh fruit and hints of flowers. Flavor: slightly bitter with a hint of bubble gum and fresh wheat that fades to a slight sour note on finish.

Bottle.  Faint grains and hops in the nose.  Bland fruitiness nears apple juice, but theres no sign of infection.  Pale clear golden pour with a large , densely foamy white head.  Lightly malty, lightly metallic taste, bland and watery with subtle wheat notes and bg stabs at lemony citrus and lemon meringue.  And a nod at apple juice.  Bubblegum and near-honey but only after time.  Light body but not too watery.  I have to say, this is still a decent drink, despite the knocks; theres a pleasant drinking experience to be found here, though very little of anything recognizable as beer.
Pours  golden with a few floaties and a nice sized head. Aroma is banana, citrus, and some breadiness. Flavor is a light sweetness with a little sour at the end.

500mL Bottle. Tangy soft wheat, cotton and blanket nose. Powdery. Lemons and German yeast. Pours a brilliantly shining deep straw, with a very clean bleached white head hanging above. Flavor is a gentle, lightly sweet wheat-sugar, bread, and dough. Medium-bodied, with a decent balance between the sugar body and a bit of leafy hops. Pretty bland through and through, really. A gentle wheat sugar picks up some alcohols, leaves the yeast flavors behind and glides out on a bit of cone. Drinkable, thats for sure, thanks to carbonation and lightness, but maybe not interesting enough to enjoy. Some faint fruits finish the back end and a touch of metallic quality muddles the middle.
Pale Golden with frothy white head. Citrus aroma and bite with a little banana and sour.  Kind weak finish, just disappears.

500 ml bottle courtesy and thanks to Dchmela. A clear golden pour topped with a generous creamy froth. The nose shows hay and banana, lemon drops and citrus rind. The flavours are quite citric, with the dominant taste being sweet lemon drop with a hint of lime as well. In the middle, I get hay and biscuit, leading to a slightly spicy (coriander) and creamy finish. Quite quaffable, especially on my porch on this summer like, spring evening. Thanks Dave for trading this to me. I have been 4 years searching for this style, and my quest is complete.

this is actually my first german kristallweizen: i am looking for a light wheat that is great for a quick quench, like a berliner weisse without the high acidity, but with typical ABV--this unfortunately falls short because though the flavor is nice, the palate cannot make up for it; primarily flat, and as if it wants to be cloying... nice, clean aroma and flavor, but nothing outstanding.
Looks good smells good. This is very tasty. Light, smooth, not too wheaty, its also got just a hint of creaminess to it. A very nice beer, good brewery. Goes excellent with pizza.

Pours a crystal clear light orange color with a small white head.  Smells of some light citrus fruit and mild wheat.  Some light grain shows up as well.  The flavor was of some musty bready wheat and more citrus than anything.  Pretty lifeless and boring with a mild skunk character.  Not a style I will be revisiting any time soon.

Bottle. Medium sized white head that mostly diminished, fair amount of lacing, transparent, visible carbonation, and a pale yellow hue. Nose was malt, sweet, banana, and notes of lemon. Flavor was semi-sweet, some malt, crisp, banana, some wheat and somewhat thin and watery tasting. Tingly, watery, thin mouthfeel and medium body. Fairly balanced beer, but nothing special stood out that left me wanting this beer again. Its not a bad beer by any means, it just did not leaving me wanting more.

Bottle from Sams on Marcey st, Chicago.  Clear light gold with medium creamy white head.  Aroma is orange, sweet, light yeast and lemon.  Flavor is sweet orange, light banana, lemon, yeast and wheat, has a sourness of a berlinerweisse.  Heavy carbonation that leads to a nice creaminess over a medium to full body.  Very nice, though the lack of cloudiness is really throwing me off.

Pours gold with a white head.  Elements of bananas are more prevelant here than on the others I sampled.  Some light lemony splashes also present.  Tastes crisp with some fruitiness to it and a tarte finish.
Light, clear yellow color.  Smell of malt, minor banana, flowers and some wheat.  Tastes very light with bananas, malt and minor hops.

A blast of German malt hits you and quickly fades to be replaced by light banana ester, filtered clear, light German malt flavor,with little patches of the banana ester,with a drying wheat aftertaste. Acceptable ,thanks Kingpin

Crystal clear golden body with a large frothy white head. Sweet banana and light toasty malt aroma. Sweet floral hop flavor with light banana and a touch of earthy wheat. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

This bottled brew from Indianapolis pored a large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored long lasating bubbles that left behind a transparent orange colored soft carbonated body and asitcky thick foamy lacing.  The aroma was bready malt hop straw and was mild.  The platate was of soft hopsweakly tingly at the start and medium in the finish.  The flavor contained notes of bread hops mild malt and a slight aftertaste of the wheat.

Bottle. Light malt notes of light bread, straw and nutty, light hop notes of flowers and herbs, and a moderate broth and musty smell for the yeast with corriander in the background. Head is large and rocky/bubbly, white with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is sparkling yellow/amber. Flavor starts lightly acidic and bitter and finishes lightly bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a fizzy carbonation. Very refreshing when cold, full of body and flavor when warmed. The more I drank of this the more I liked it.
Pours a golden yellow with a small white head and nice carbonation.  The nose is of fruit and honey.  There is a light sweetness on the palate with a nice clean finish.  A very nice Kristallweizen.
Youll either really like it or think its nothing special, there are few in betweens. Outstandingly sweet and with a honey taste to it. Worthy of casual drinking.
Bold head, small inviting aroma.  Flavor is refreshing and has a hint of honey and fruit.  Finish is wonderful and leaves you wanting more.  Truly a great Kristall Weizen.
It had a hazy gold appearance with a smooth finish but it was missing flavor.
I was really drunk when I had this so I dont remember much.  Im sorry.  Beer number 12 that day.

Pint bottle from Bevmo. Poured a golden color with a white head that quickly disappeared. Aroma is faint with some spice (perhaps cloves and allspice, really to faint to tell.) Flavor was unremarkable, light wheat flavor, this was a very bland beer. Hops were pretty much non-existent. Mouthfeel was thin and watery. Finish was short and clean. Overall: this is sure to be a hit with fans of bland  beer.

Gold and filtered. Mildly clovey and fruity aroma. I did not thing it was strong, but I could smell it. Flavor is similar. It is like when the yeast is filtered out, the strong fruity esters leave. Its got some wheat, some banana, and some clove, but they are not as nice as they are in the unfiltered version. Light with nice carbonation.

Golden colored, lively carbonation. Little white head. Strongly fruity aroma, banana with spices come up nicely. Medium bodied. Flavor is also crispy with obvious banana and medium carbonation. Banana again in aftertaste, some round spiciness and skunky cardboard also there. Good crispy brew.

light clove aroma, light wheat flavor, touch of bitterness

Aroma is hay, slightly shitty. Clear yellow pour with a thick, fat, white creamyhead. Clove predominates, a tad phenolic. Nothing on the palate. Thin. Miller lite with a clovish flair. This was my third of the weizen trifecta from Tucher and Im not impressed by any of them. Weihenstephaner is so much better.
A grainy nose on a yellow body with minimal head.  Grain flavor with plenty of metal and a watery finish.

The first beer in the Joebrews blind tasting at the Cellars.  Gold color with a thin head.  Strong aroma of yeast.  Large grainy and corn taste with very little wheat lingering in the background.  I thought of this as a light Belgian Ale with some wheat in it before it was revealed.

A treat to a rare style, but the beer is not so good.  I tasted it blind and thought it was an American wheat.  Light wheat in the aroma and flavor.  Lemon in aroma as well.  Grainy finish with light yeast.
Very light...typical hefeweizen aroma...some unplaceable spice...nothing to write home about...but nice on a summer day.

Sampled at Cellars Wine & Spirits via  joebrews favorites week #7 tasting. Pours a clear light pale gold brew with a thick head that slowly dissolves and leaves behind a nice lacing. Aroma is very faint with some light banana esters, thin malt, orange peel and a touch of spiced/flowery hops. Tate is light bodied, high carbonation with flavors of citrus, light malt and some banana esters. Finish is slightly metalic, dry and a lingering sharp citrus flavor. A little watery for my taste.

Bottle. Its been a while since Ive seen the Tucher beers in the area and all of a sudden  theyre back! Pours a clear gold. Tall foamy, rocky, white head. Aroma is wheat, soft lemon, grass, light yeast notes and bubblegum. Taste is wheat, soft malts, mild lemony tartness, yeast and bubblegum.  Light grass and dough as well. Body is light and crisp with moderate carbonation and light dryness towards the end. Finishes with more wheat and yeast, lemon juice, doughy malts and grass. Most of the sweetness is gone during the finish. Nice summer beer!
Bottle poured a clear yellow with a small lasting white head. Aromas of wheat and citrus. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, bread and a hint of citrus with a smooth clean finish.
Average all around, nothing special either in a positive or negative way. Some citrus and wheat in the aroma, light on the flavor overall.  Appearance is standard.

Draft... Hazy yellow ale with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The nose consists of lightly kilned barley malt and wheat with a hint of banana. Decently hopped for a well-balanced flavor. High on fruity, citrus esters; low on spicy phenols... rumors of bubblegum and butter. Light-bodied with stinging carbonation. Short, crisp, clean finish.

Bottled. Golden colour, big foamy white head. Aroma is citrus, wheat and some malts and banana. Flavour is wheat, citrus, some banana and butteryness. A quite pleasantly mixed brew, and very nice for being a kristallweizen.

Bottled, alc. 5.1 % (BB 02/2008)
Pale yellow color, big cloudy white head. Leather, bubblegum and banana in the nose. Slightly acidic, banana fruity but dry hefeweizen. Quite thin mouthfeel. Lemony and refreshing but lacks depth, but of course it is more because of style than beer itself. As a kristallweizen this is good.

Aromas of pentyl acetates. Light brassy color. Fluffy white head. Definitely banana in the start. Rather thin. Slightly, very slightly, sour. Quite pleasant and refreshing. Low carbonation. A bit of lemon in the finish. Very mild bitter. Relatively dry.

There are many excellent weizenbiers that come from Bavaria, and this one does not disappoint.  It pours a medium amber-gold with a nice, long lasting head,  The nose is light on the esters but very pleasing.  The taste is wheaty but not as pronounced as some weizens, and the carbonation is slighly less than some weizens.  Aftertaste is pleasing and lasts a while.  I will defnitely buy this one again.

Bottle shared by sliffy. Golden pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of lemon/lemon zest, and yeast. Flavors were of yeast, lemon zest and dirty tap water. Lively carbonation over the light body with a clean finish.

Sweet malt dominates the aroma.Pours a light gold with a medium off white head.Sweet malt and hints of light fruit make up the flavor.Medium mouthfeel with some light fruit and some yeast in the finish.
bottle.large lasting head.light banana,bubble gum aroma.clear gold appearance.light bodied,refreshing.A pretty good Kristallweizen.
Very strong weizen beer, nearly 80th percentile in its category. Pours a decent but dissapating head, smells great.

Bottle, 5.1%. Weak, sweetish aroma with hints of soap and wheat. Clear golden colour. Big, nice, stable white head. OK banana flavour, low citricness. Wheat mouthfeel. Actually a Kristallweizen which tastes like wheat beer.

Bottle: Clear golden color with a big white head. Aroma, yeast, some wheat, and lemon. Flavor, yeasty, crisp wheaty malts, some lemon and other light citrus notes, no bitterness, but kind of a sticky sweetness on the finish.
I have always enjoyed this beer.  Pours with a nice foamy white head.  Slightly sweet with a definit banana and citrus flavor.  Not bad for a wheat beer and fairly refreshing.

Bottle from BevMo. Pours clear golden color with a foamy white head. Aroma is mostly yeasty with a bit of graininess. Slightly sweet yeastiness up front. Goes into a bit of a bitter flavor. Nice spiciness.

not a bad weizen. pours and smells like a "trad" weizen only its kristall clear. ( for some reason this makes me think of "flavored" beer. I dont know why??!!) very nice if drank relitivly cold, but once it starts too cool off it turns a little sweet. not my first pick for a weizen, but is quite refreshing.

Pours pale yellow with lots of lively dancing carbonation and a pillow white head.  The aroma is rich and smooth banana esters and some creamy wheat.  Medium / light body with a frothy carbonation distributing the flavors throughout the mouth.  The flavor pretty much matches what was on the aroma.  The finish adds a bit of spice and the banana starts coming off sweeter, like candied dried bananas.  An okay refreshing beer, but the sweetness and banana dominance are a bit much for me.

Bottle pours golden and sparkling with a short white head that stays pretty well and leaves scant lace on the side of the Weizen glass.  Aroma of light clove, bannana, and some yeast.  Good clove and bannana flavor.  Light body with good carbonation and a  nice crisp and clean palate.  A very refreshing brew...

Tucher Kristall Weizen
Half Liter bottle
Unknown bottling (notched 1 and 8 in the third segment, 333 cap citing their 1672-2005 anniversary)

Poured a clear dark yellow with a huge fully  lasting frothy white head with good lacing and massive carbonation.

Smelt of moderate cloves and bananas, light bread, some sweat.

Taste was upfront moderate sweet spicy bananas and grain followed by a moderate sweet cookie and bitter pungent mold finish of average length.  Palate was light bodied, watery, fizzy and lightly astringent.

Overall, I never had this style before, but  everything seems to be on par with what Ive read.  The yeasty finish is killer.

Perfectly Golden and Klear with a towering foamy white froth.  Crisp bubbles cascading to the surface.  Aroma of wheat malts, banana, and clove are very obvious!  Very sweet flavor.  This is a great beer for the newbie rednecks I work with.  Beerlamb you should try this!  Very light and refreshing.
Deep golden with an initially large, fluffy white head.  Very nice lacing.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Slightly sweet, fruity flavor.  Nice spicy finish.  Quite enjoyable and refreshing.

Very good nose.  I picked up the essence of banana and spice.  The taste was smooth and light.  Change from a borderline sweet taste as it entered the mouth to a slight bitter at the end.  Quickly disappeared from palate.  This could be one of my staple beers.
Golden with orange overtones.  Great head that lastted quite a while.  Good lacing.  Nose of fruit and spice.  Very nice mouthfeel.  This is a very nice hefe. From bottle in Erfurt, Germany.

Poured a golden yellow with slight orange hues (for a hefe anyway), nice large pillowy initial head, and ok lacing. The aroma was bananas, light spicing, and a touch of grass (a lot for a hefe). The flavor was wheaty, bananas, light cloves, and a bitter grass finish. Lemons came out as the beer warmed along with a phenolic zip, including even a peppery finish. This was different than many other Germany weiss beers Ive had and worth a try, but nothing to search too hard for.

aroma of lemon, banana, vanilla.  clear golden beer with a tall white creamy head.  flavor is grainy and doughy with some clove like spices and some citrus.  no apparent banana in flavor.  light bodied.  alcohol becomes apparent in flavor and aroma as it warms.
Pours a refreshing sun lit clear with a white head. Nose is yeast and banana. Taste is tucher yeast, and carries a bit of a dunklefunk about it. Not too bad. crisp and refreshing
Had on tap. Came with a lemon. Refreshing taste. It poured with a nice head and is the type beer that goes down easy.

Bottle. Clear medium amber hue with a large frothy white head that was mostky lasting with good lacing. Moderate banana wheat aroma. Light to medium body with soft carbonation. Light sweet bitter balanced flavor with an average finish. Drinkable average brew.

I poured this into a Weizen glass from a 1 pint 1 fluid once bottle.  It formed one of the prettiest heads Ive ever seen on a beer.  It was 2 inches high, very creamy and dense looking and it lasted forever.  I finally had to have a sip through the head which was a good thing to do as it turns out.  The appearance is a crystal clear light gold with streams of bubbles supporting that head.  The aroma was fruity with a hint of clove.  The taste matches the aroma up front.  It starts to go light in the middle and finishes with a nice little hop bite at the end.  It is a very refreshing and good looking brew.  Id suck down a lot of these.

Pour is a clear yellow with a white head.  Aroma is a tiny bit of banana with some malts in there.  Flavor is very sweet and almost like a honey beer.  Nothing really else going on with this one.  Creamy and easy to drink but nothing to gt excitied about.

Looks like swill or a pale lager.  Smells like pale lager and wheat.  Flavor is decent, like putting more wheaty flavors in Bud Light or something.  This is the first of the style Ive had I believe so I may re rate if i discover Im terribly wrong about it.

Bottle enjoyed at one of the Disney Worlds parks. Poured a medium and see through golden color with an averaged sized head. They served this one with a slice of orange in my glass (bastards). Aromas and tastes of citrus, yeast, and I found it to also have a light spicy and earthiness to it.

The aroma is malty, with an emphasis on wheat. There is also yeast, and a tiny bit of smoke. The appearance is golden with a medium size head. The flavor is malty with medium bitterness and some citrus. The palate is on the thin side but it seems to work ok with this one. The aftertaste is sour and malty.

Huge white over explosively carbonated clear medium-golden. Banana & delicate incense in aroma. Bready flavor to an otherwise typical hefeweizen experience with fruit and spice. Creamy, dry and very good.<font size=-4>From bottle at <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Place Restaurant and Beer Garden, LaGrange, IL<font size=-1>
Bottle. Pale golden color with a big white head. Yeasty, wheat aroma. Wheat flavor thats clean with a bit of citrus. Lighter bodied. Easy drinking.

Pours light golden with a thick white head.  Aroma is slight metallic, dusty yeast, with a very mild banana hint.  Taste is tart, acidic, and quite wheaty.  Light bodied and highly carbonated.  Very subdued hefe esters, still quite refreshing.

This is a mild Hefe-tasting brew with the standard lemon bitterness and salty nose that youd expect from a light colored Tucher.  The mouthfeel is thin and unspectacular, and I prefer the Hefe or Dopple.

Medium gold hue; medium, foamy, white head.  Light banana and cream of wheat aroma.  Tastes more like bubble gum though.  Moderately sweet, lightly acidic (tart) flavor.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter finish.  Medium-light body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.  Nothing bad, just not that much /good/ going on.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2005 Good beer. Not great. Not my favorite 
Tucher. But a good light summer drink.

(16.9 oz bottle: $1.99 at BevMo in Carmel Mountain/San Diego, CA)  It pours a medium yellow color, crystal clear of course, with plentiful carbonation bubbles hurrying to join their brethren atop the liquid.  The head is tall and white in color, with large air pockets visible along the edge of the glass.  Initially, the nose is quite sour, but that seems to fade away, even after letting my nose readjust.  After things settle down, the beer smells somewhat sweet and oddly grainy like a cream ale, with the expected wheat aroma behind the cream ale scent.  Strange, but okay I guess.  The flavor is pretty light in general, again being on the sweet side, with mild spice, yeast and wheat flavors, and minimally bitter.  But in the finish, theres that sweet flavor thats reminiscent of a cream ale.  Body is fairly thin, and the finish is watery, but while the beer is in the mouth, its smooth, creamy and lightly carbonated on the palate.  No lacing.  Very easy to drink, pleasant enough, but lacking the character I was hoping for.

Light white head.  Clear yellow body.  I never thought Id be writing this as a description for the aroma, but I think I smelled cat piss!  Could also be skunked.  Im not big on Kristallweizens so I may never know if I just got a bad bottle.  Flavor is bland and overpowered by the undesirable fragrances I described above.  Slightly sweet, dry, and bitter on the way out.
rather watery, slighty fizzy.  Real light body, seems like something youd get at a crappy grocery still.  water, corn and water.

Very clear golden color with a nice white head that lasted till the last drop. Very smooth and refreshing, but not much flavor going on here at all, slight I mean very slight banana, but not much seperating this from a buttwiper.
Pours pale gold with big, creamy, white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves, hopcit, some fruit.  Nice hefe and fruity aroma.  Tastes hopcity, with some cloves, banana, and honey.  Light on the palate.

I hope for Tuchers sake that I got a bad bottle.  Horrid balance, weak hop bitterness, and to be quite honest a sickening corn-sweet malt.  The beer looked gorgeous in the glass, but caught retarded somewhere.  Im usually pretty happy with this brewery, but this one was for the sink.
Decent Kristal...Poured it Saturday afternoon...waited patiently for the head to fade...and was able to drink it sometime Sunday morning.   Other than that, middle of the road in most respects.

not a really good beer.   something that me and daniel (00cobraR) did not enjoy.  ended up pouring some in the sink.  yellow, skunky, and a little fruity, this is not something i would care to drink on numerous occasions.  the dopple bock tho....thats another story.
Pours a golden yellow with a nice white head.  Flavor is some what malty with a corn flavor that is not to apealing.  Aroma is kinda skuny and not so good either.
(Bottle 50 cl) Clear, pale golden with a nice creamy and rather stable head. Nice hoppy nose. Slightly watery, dry and not very bitter. A pleasure. 300599

The final frontier. My last style I have not sampled. So this is a big moment in my small world. Well the moment was certainly better than the beer. A very faint citrus aroma. This beer has no sweetness at all and is very dry. Somewhat doughy and lemony. Boring and nothing I desire to return to.

Pours a very attractive golden with a nice white head.  Aroma is pleasant and on the sweet side.  Almost have to check the label to know this is a Weizen.  Very little wheat is noticeable.   However, the flavor is enjoyable, if on the mild side.  Finish is very nice.  Pick up a pint and enjoy!

Bottle.  Pours a yellow gold color with a small white head.  Aroma is fruity, a little spicy, malty and grassy.  A medium to light bodied kristal weiss.  Taste is malty and fruity with orange and banana flavors.  I wish this wasnt filtered.   Theres a slight taste of spicy hops. Light and refreshing.  Nothing bad, but nothing really good here either. Finish is clean and smooth.  Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Pours crystal clear golden color with thin head. Slight banana and clove esters. Fairly bland. Typical kristal. Not bad.
Blond with a medium head. Straight forward beer. The aroma and taste is light fruity. Good beer but nothing extra.
Bottle.  Banana-apple aroma.  Birght yellow color - clear with ample head.  Lightly sweet banana flavor with a clove finish.  Typical Kristall watery palate.  Pretty good for a Kristall.

Deep golden and clear with a big rocky head.  Citric-apple aroma.  Smooth and more heavy-handed than I expected for a Kristal ... lightly sweet, with little wheat character, maybe just a glimmer of the weizen character in the finish.  Lagery.

Crystal clear apple juice body topped by big white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, bread, some clove, faint bubblegum.  Taste is medium sweet, clove, some banana, bubblegum, wheat.  Light body with some acidity in the finish.  Bubblegum becomes more pronounced as it warms.

This one is as promised. Kristall klar. Very bubbly pour with a huge head in my Weizen glass that seems like itll stay that way awhile. Good retention.. Light clove aroma, light citrus also. Body is smooth, carbonation on the low side. Flavor is pretty good but a tad watery. Good wheat malt, some peppery notes. Overall flavor and aroma are weak but a decent average Weizen in my opinion.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Clear and yellow golden with ample bubbly head. Bannana, cloves, bubblegum and the works. Nice carbonation. A little lacking in aroma and quite weak flavor. But floral and sweet. I like it.

Clear yellow body, massive, pillowy white head.  Nose has plenty of clove, some toasty malt and banana.  Flavor is a bit on the light side, some crispness and lemon, then usual banana, yeast, and clove.

Head is initially large, creamy, white, fully lasting. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted bread), with light notes of lemon peel, banana, metal shavings. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter, slightly unclean. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Suitably refreshing and flavorful, with a nice mouthfeel, and looks very nice for a kristall, but could stand to be a little cleaner smelling/tasting.

A nice white head, good looking cloudy white body, a mildly citric aroma... I find this to be a truly decent wheat, although not my favorite.  There was, as Id noted from other reviewers, a bit of a grassy aftertatste, but it wasnt unpleassant.  This is a good, warm weather drink.

Huge white head in my hefe glass. It left a lot of lacing as I drank it. Nice bright gold coloring and lots of carbonation. The aroma is slight banana and some must. The taste is metallic and has notes of grass and some lemon rinds. This is not the best I have had in the style. However, it is still decent.

From the bottle at Yeomans Road Pub in Tampa.

Looks pretty sitting in the glass. Light gold/yellow.

Little aroma I couldnt detect any wheat notes. Carbonation is what I smelled.

Flavor was odd. I cant taset any wheat either. Sorta watery carbonated and citrus infused Pilsner is what it tastes like.

Feels like a lager on the tongue.

Im not sure what this is supposed to taste like, but to me it tastes like a souped up Bud or Coors. Maybe not a bad thing, but not my style.

Light gold. Clear. Thick creamy head and some webbed lacing. Citrus and wheat aromas. Some hints of banana. Flavors are sharp. Citrus bites you. Bittering hops. Wheat. Musky malts. Malty palate, some wheat. Thin body. Finishes citrusy.

Straw color with a bit of gold, thick retentive head and lacing. Aroma is sweet with esters and a bit of pale malt & wheat. The flavor is watery, citrusy tart and a rush of wheat. Finishes watery, a good malty backbone and a light body. Eh, a watery german hefe, whats new?

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2006 This is my first Kristalweizen. A Tucher which so far has been a company that has not impressed me overly much. Sampled from a 16 oz brown bottle the beer poured a medium golden color with a large yellow head. The aroma is wheat and a hint of tang. The texture is crisp and clean. There is not a whole lot of flavor to be found. Some wheat. Very mild citrus. Not much else. No aftertaste to speak of. Refreshing but that is all.

Pours a clear gold with a large, fluffy white head. Aroma is faint, malty and a bit of fruit, maybe banana. Flavor is similar to Tuchers Dunkles hefeweizen, but less robust. Not bad, but not my favorite from this particular brewery.

Yellow gold color. Small head. Aroma is fruity, malty and grassy. A medium to light bodied kristal weiss. Malts are fruity with orange and banana flavors. Very clear colors, I am assuming they filter this beer. Slightly spicy hops. Light and refreshing. Smooth and clean. Nothing bad, but nothing really good here either. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

2003 bottle.  Pours a light pear-yellow.  Kristal clear (haha, get it), absolute massive filtration.  Big white head and decent lacing, surprisingly.  Aroma is light, smells of warm summer breeze and bananas, with some light orange zest and a touch of spicy hops.  Flavor was light and mouthfeel was spritzy.  For as much as I hate this style, it did taste pretty good.  Citrus, banana, and a good spicy hops bouquet.  Dosent have much mouthfeel, no sediment to hang on to.  I will say, however, that this wasnt as altogether souless as I thought a Kristalweizen would be.

Billowing foamy head seemingly miles high {exaggerating}, clearer, golden but watery composition (perhaps this is what a Kristall (crystal) Weizen is, though. I guess this is my first Kristall Weizen - I do not remember that specification on a beer before. Well, it's good, but it lacks - particularly in flavour and palate. Contrasted to Tucher's Dunkles Hefe-Weizen, this stuff is weak, diluted swill - but that is too harsh. The Dunkles Hefe-Weizen is a truly great beer, and this one is merely slightly above average. Thus, it is a matter of distinguishing between more-towards-normality or a more-towards-excellence beer. I choose Tucher's outstanding Dunkles Hefe-Weizen.
Nice clear golden color with a small creamy white head that lasted for a bit. Mild malt and wheat nose. Flavors to match aroma. Pretty good.
Malty and yeasty aroma.  Pours yellow with a large white head and shows fair lacing.  Initially sweet and then bitter.  Light, oily and soft on the palate.

Nice clear golden color,small creamy white head that hung around for a decent time,leaving a nice lace.Malty,wheat aroma with hints of citrus and maybe a slight hint of berry in there as well.Wheat and light malt taste with a mild lemon flavor coming on and fairly sweet.The hops do manage to make an appearance but it's mild and fleeting at best.I also can just detect a mild spice after the brew begins to warm a bit.The finish is mild fruity and wheaty and sweet.A highly drinkable brew,and well worth getting if you can find it.

Great billowing head, decent lacing.  Heavily carbonated gold color, looks like a cheap lager.  smells slightly skunky (old bottle?), sweet, almost like pure sugarcane.  Flavor is again sweet, citrusy, and a bit spicy.  Reminded me of a weak belgian single.

Pale gold pilsener looking beer here. Nich foamy white head. Slight bananan/bubble gum smell. Very light metallic flavor. Some banana, some bubble gum, but not much else. Slight sourness in the back of the throat and on your lips but that is it actually. Mediocre at best.

Large white head on a clear yellow / gold body.  Good lacing.  Aroma is malty with hints of bannana and wheat.  Taste is sl. sweet and mild.  Not alot here but imenantly drinkable.  No hoppy bittrness here.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2003 Has a nice head, and pretty good aroma, but this beer is about as average as you can get. There is absolutely nothing special about it.
Golden with a huge frothy head. Less than pleasant lightly malty aroma. Smooth and boring, lighlty hoppy, watery mouthfeel, slighy bannana hints.

Pour clear gold with a large white head.  A fruiy citrus aroma.  A very nice light, but not watery, mouthfeel.  The flavor is yeasty.  It is not too sweet.  Has a good balance.  The overall flavor is subdued without being weak or bland.  An exellent summer brew or when something light and refreshing is desired.
Big fluffy white head.  Clear golden hue.  Banana nose.  Pleasant mouthfeel, although all flavors are pretty bland.  Nothing special, and as Oakes says why bother without the yeast.

Pours a clear golden pale, huge white head that mosty lasts, leaves good lacing.  Lot's of tiny bubbled carbonation present in the body.  Aroma is soft, mostly citric (lemon/lemon peel), some banana.  Flavor is sour, citric, light amounts of banana.  Thin mouthfeel, very bubbly (maybe even "spritzy").  Definately takes a back seat to the Helles Hefe, IMO.
Clear yellow with big foamy head. Slightly estery nose, a bit yeasty at first sip, but very light on taste overall. Medium body is sweet and sort of dry at the end.
Thick white head.  Clear golden yellow.  Rocky creamy head.  Tip of the tongue yeast slightly tangy.  Not much happpening throughout this beer.
golden straw body with a huge rocky head.  lits of tiny bubbles.  lots of bananna esters, a hint of cloves.  clean, crisp and clear as a bell.   Yeast finish rounds out with a light wheat finish.
Drinkable kristalwizen style wheat beer.  Has a very cloudy appearance.  It's not a bad beer to drink during the summer.
Pale yellow.  Banana and some light yeast in the nose.  The body is slightly sweet and fruity with a light hop bitterness way at the end.  Light, uncomplex, not a big fan of these Kristall-Weizens.

Ah.  Delicious.  Upon pouring this brew, I noticed that something was missing...  The cloudy color!  Where's the yeast?  Ah.  I see.  I'm a "Kristall", the bottle reads.  I was afraid...  Very afread.  How can we have a German Wheat without the typical cloudiness?  But the brew smelled good, like a spicy fruit.  That seems correct.  And the taste?  It's very much like a "Paulaner Light".  The Alcohol is still there, but theres something missing in the flavor compared to other German Wheat biers.  Nevertheless, it's still tasty.  Even though it's not my favorite wheat, it's quite enjoyable.

This beer pours a very bright yellow color with a large, but quickly dissipating, head.  The aroma is the same as a weiss/wheat beer.  Very grainy nose.  The flavor is that of a wheat beer with some added spices for a little extra flavor.  If you're a fan of weiss beers, you should try this one.
Light golden orange with medium head. Slight hops and honey aroma. Thin body, lively bubbly carbonation. Tastes watered down overall.
Nice sweet almost rosy aroma.  Brew pours pale gold with a huge head that is retained.  There is quite a bit of carbonation here.  Flavor is sweet and light.  Fairly nice beer, especially for summer.
Clear golden - ugh.  Banana, hint of spice on the nose.  Light, slightly watery body.  Background phenols, but this is a typically bland kristalweizen.  No yeast - why bother?
clear gold, white head.  grapey, malt and wheat aroma.  more wheaty flavour with mild clove and banana, bready malt and icing sugar flavours.
Crystal clear (he-he). White sweet frothy head. Nice soft wheat aroma, fuller than most (banana, oat and good yeast).
Light wheat aroma, pale yellow, with a small white head. Good wheat taste, some banana and spice too. Light bodied, fresh, a decent beer.
Clear yellow w/ big white head. Yeasty aroma of banana. Light, soft feel. Clean, lightly tart flavour of banana & cherry. Decent hops.

Light banana aroma emanates from a beer the color of Budweiser (though, I admit, the creamy white head is nicer).  Flavor is banana-like, with slight tang, and overall lighter than that of a hefeweizen.  Refreshing as a session beer, but doesn't stand out in any way.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2003 Quite good as most German wheats are. I like the Kyrstal style Weiss as it is very refreshing and not heavy. This is certainly not the best weiss beer I have had but it is high in quality. If it was not so clear I would have given its appearance higher.Do I taste honey? Anyway the best kyrstals may be light but have a full body. This is a little thin.

This weizen pours a nice, honey colored gold with a big, rocky white head that is mostly lasting. The aroma is yeasty and spicy with some decent clove and banana notes. It is very crisp with full carbonation. It has a medium body with some good wheat and banana flavors. A decent German wheat, smooth and very refreshing.
Nice colour and head, the nose is not very present. It is a bit wheaty for my taste but it has a slight hint of lemon. Good to drink, but not too many of them in a row.
Very pleasant hops aroma; mild taste with a hint of citrus - a bit light for my taste.

Light nose - almost nothing, deep gold color, big foamy head. Clear and fizzy. Pretty substantial wheat flavors for a crystal. Citrusy tones in the middle and end. Creamy mouth feel, medium body, and a pretty good balance.
Citrusy banana and vanilla taste and nose. Medium foamy head, golden with lively carbonation. Fullmouth yeasty, refreshing. Nice.
Clear straw color with a tall fluffy white head.  Mild malt and wheat nose.  Flavors to match aroma.  Well made, but boring.
Pretty straw color; Pure white and frothy; nose was grassy. Crisp. Decent wheat character. not my favorite style at all.
Another boring wheat.  The presence of spearmint jumped out of me as this dry beer went down the pipe.  Soured slightly as it warmed.

Has a golden color with a lot of carbonation and kind of a skunky smell.  Taste lightly malted, skunky and finishes with a little bitterness.  Overall I was kind of disappointed with this beer due to the skunky carbonated taste.

Best beer on Earth.  Theres nothing in the world to substitute for a cold bottle and Ophthalamias Dominion (or your favorite klassisch metal album) for the ultimate just-off-the-clock experience of the working man.

This beer poured a golden color and formed a nice huge sudsy white head that left some lace as it subsided. A bit of carbonation present. The aroma was of banana and clove. The flavor was of malt and some spice. The finish was a little bready yet sprite due in part to the carbonation. An interesting twist on the wheat beer style. I rather like it.
a rare occasion where i preferred a brewers kristall. not as salty as the other tucher wheat beers and quite drinkable. quite dark for a kristall

Kristall Klear lightly golden body.  poured with a huge head thad didnt last long.  Thin mouthfeel and less impressive flavors than their regular wheat.  Some tangy tartness and spice, but not enough.
Color and aroma are terrific but flavor falls short.  It remains refreshing like a true wheat, very little fruit like some weize Ive had.
This is to the regular Tucher as Genesis circa ABACAB is to Genesis circa Nursery Cryme; I can see why some people like it, but its much less complex than I prefer. It looks pretty nice, though.

Expected more from this beer when I witnessed the frothy head being formed - I was disappointed. Not a bad wheat - but nothing exciting. Just enough maltiness to make it interesting to the bottom of the glass.
Kind of malty, and the bodys pretty nice, but what flavor is in that body? A bit of sour, wheatiness, clove, but not much. Otherwise kind of watery. Nose is not up to snuff. Hmmm...
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Excellent wheat beer. Very drinkable, but expensive.

Wheat-malty nose at first, and then the yeast comes through.  Perhaps a little smokiness in there.  A monster pour! 10:1 foam to beer ratio in a glass stein, and the head stood there like fiberglass insulation for 5 minutes. High marks for appearance, despite lackluster label.  Grainy and wheat-musky with some wood and peat tones.  Super clean.  Mildly tart finish with good body.  The actual palate is about a 2, but Im rating it at 3 since its weiss.
Like the other Tuchers, nothing to get too excited about.  Lacks that wheaty aroma and flavor.  Nothing bad but not great, either.
Another good weize beer.  I thought it had a little bit of an apple cider flavor in it, but it is faint and not that bad.  Good wheat flavors and all around a good tasting beer.
Kind of a sweet taste. I noticed an apple flavor along with the malt.  Pretty good..
Very pleasant. Nice and tart flavor. Not too intense. Good summer drinking.
Talk about pure heaven in a golden soda!
After trying their Heffe, was eager to try other beers in the line. Nothing special (for a quality brew) but beats any Mass Producers run-off...

Excellent presentation. Snow white rocky and sustained foam with great lacing although the color is not exceptionally brilliant. A surprising bit of Saaz in the otherwise mild and typical Bavarian weisse nose. Very dry. Clean and simple.
Ok as far as non-bottle conditioned goes.  Nothing spectacular.
Wheat and a clean fresh malt nose and a nice some what dry finish, fair hops to boot.
